description.narrative: Sustainable models developed for the effective delivery of rights-based, inclusive and accountable rule of law and security and being implemented across regions in Somaliland.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Multi Partner Trust Fund for Somalia

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of victims of SGBV are satisfied by police and prosecutors’ investigations in SGBV cases (16.1.3) 2. % of public who are receiving better policing and court services and feel safe in the piloted areas (16.1.4) 3. Number of unsentenced detainees and undertrials decreases in the prisons (16.3.2)

comment.narrative: Data from 2016 available; Youth Violence baseline survey 2015, administrative data from civil service commission, survey reports, new code of conduct and disciplinary regulations developed. No guide on policy and legislative process, no uniform and integrated standards on legal aid, and no community paralegals. Community policing in 4 police stations.

Targets 2020 1.1. Drafting process SOP developed and agreed by all relevant stakeholders. 1.3. 2 policies developed with support of the project 2.1. Two (2) Consultations on TDR/ADR practices organised one each in Berbera and Hargeisa. 3.1. 8 additional districts in which mobile courts are operational 3.2. 3 districts in which mobile justice system specialized for SGBV 3.3. 6 regions where manual case management is functional 3.4. Inspection scheme designed and approved by the Judicial Commission 3.5) Planning and design initiated of construction of Buroa Regional Court 3.6) 2 parliamentary workshops to analyse and review the draft legal aid Bill 3.7) Legal aid model and guidelines reviewed and consulted upon 3.8) One (1) prisons’ inspection tool and SOP developed and applied in five (5) prisons[4]. 4.1) Structure, staffing, roles and responsibilities for SGBV Centres designed, approved by the Ministry of Health and implemented 4.2) 20 SGBV centre staff trained on collection of evidence in medico-legal cases, and investigation of SGBV supported, with medico-legal examination training modules in SGBV cases, disaggregated by sex and centre. 4.3) 25 investigators and prosecutors trained on juvenile and gender needs, principles of fair trial, medico legal, SGBV 4.4) 6 juvenile and women’s units established 5.1) One women’s association functioning in Borama 5.2) 5% increase n number of women joining justice institutions and legal profession (SDG16.7.1) 5.3) 6 in regions and (1) placed in Hargeisa Safe House WAAPO - female paralegals trained to enhance referral pathway on SGBV and legal aid services 6.1) 5 (of which at least 2 women) internships at Bar Association 6.2) Graduate law Curriculum reviewed and updated 6.3) 10 (5 women) scholarships awarded 6.4) 5 judicial trainers trained, disaggregated by sex. 6.5) 2 manuals for judges’ training developed 6.7)2 trainings held for judges, prosecutors and lawyers in the regions 7.1) 2 police stations in which a community policing initiative is implemented 7.2) Design and procurement process is undertaken and construction for 4 Police Stations initiated 7.3) 25 police officers and community members of regional community police stations educated and trained on community policing (disaggregated by sex and region) 7.4) One (1) TOT curriculum developed on rights-based community partnership policing, human rights, due process, child sensitive and gender responsive policing. One (1) TOT training for 10 trainers delivered 7.5) 25 police officers trained in human rights, SGBV and child rights 7.5a) The internal complaints and discipline system policy of the Police Complaints mechanism consulted and developed. 8.1) Discussions on parole and probation policy initiated, draft developed and agreed by all stakeholders and approved by the Minister for Justice. 8.6) One feasibility study and programme on PVE in prison designed. 8.7a) 8 senior managers trained on rehabilitative approaches 8.7b) 25 junior managers trained on rehabilitative approaches 9.1) One (1) training for members and staff of the security and human rights committees of the parliament on human rights and civilian oversight of the security institutions. 9.2) 15 members of the Armed Forces Courts trained in case management, fair trail, gender perspective 9.3) Mapping of the primary and secondary legislation relevant to SSC. Approved policy decision to review and reform the legislation 9.4) Drafting process for Human Security Threat Assessment and Security Policy documents outlined and committee established to guide process. 9.5) The working group established and draft law on gratuity and pension developed 10.1a) 2 sub working groups meetings held related to Rule of law and Human Rights 10.1b) 2 sub working groups meetings held related to Security 10.1c) 2 sub working groups meetings held related to Juvenile justice 10.2) Forum of civil society, media persons, NGOs and international stakeholders established to develop integrated Rule of Law & Security Sector programme

As of December 2020: 1.1. One initial workshop was organised by MOJ to develop this 1.3. Policing Policy and principles developed 2.1. Two workshops organised in Berbera and Hargeisa. 3.1. Mobile courts are operational in districts of- Hargeisa, Gabiley, Borama, Berbera, Sheikh, Burao and Odwayne 3.2. 0 3.3. 6 Regions Manual case management is established. 3.4. Inspection scheme is in operation. Complaint mechanism in place. 3.5) 0 3.6) One Workshop done, one moved to next year. 3.7) 0 3.8) 0 4.1) 0 4.2) 0 4.3) 25 prosecutors trained (F:10, M:15) 4.4) 6 juvenile and women’s units established 5.1) 0 5.2) 0 5.3) 0 6.1) 0 6.2) 0 6.3) 0 6.4) 0 6.5) Manual development in progress 6.7) 0 7.1) Two Community Policing workshops done in Hargeisa. 7.2) 0 7.3) 55 police officers(F:15:M35) trained on policing principles and police conduct 7.4) 0 7.5) 55 police officers(F:15:M35) training in human rights, SGBV and child rights 7.5a) 0 8.1) 0 8.6) 0 8.7a)0 8.7b) 0 9.1) 0 9.2) 0 9.3) 0 9.4) Drafting process outlined and committee established 9.5) 0 10.1a) 2 sub working groups meetings held related to Rule of law and Human Rights 10.1b) 2 sub working groups meetings held related to Security 10.1c) 2 sub working groups meetings held related to Juvenile justice 10.2) 0

1.1) One (1) drafting regulation developed and adopted across the government. SOP approved by the Council of Minsters 1.2) 50 legal officers trained in rights respecting legislative drafting techniques 1.3) 3 policies developed including National Disability Policy. 4 pieces of legislation including Disability Law 2.1) two consultations organised in Burao and Borama. One policy developed and approved by the Council of Ministers One guideline developed and agreed by the stakeholders i.e. judiciary / MOJ, AGO and lawyers’ associations is implemented in the regions. 3.1) 8 districts and regions in which mobile courts are operational 3.2) 3 districts in which mobile justice system specialized for SGBV cases is available 3.3) 6 regions where manual case management is functional 3.4) one (1) complaint mechanism developed and implemented. Judicial complaint mechanism is being regularly monitored and reported upon. 3.5) Buroa Regional Court Construction undertaken and made operational 3.6) Legal Aid Law finalised and approved by the Council of Ministers 3.7) Legal aid model implemented by all relevant stakeholders in regions 3.8) Ten (10) prisons monitored using inspection tool 4.1) SGBV cases data in centres documented and coordinated and discussed with follow up actions 4.2) 20 SGBV centre staff trained on collection of evidence in medico-legal cases 4.3) 75 investigators and prosecutors trained on juvenile and gender needs, principles of fair trial, medico legal, SGBV 4.4) juvenile and women’s units established 5.1) one women’s association functioning in Burao 5.2) 20% increase in number of women joining justice institutions and legal profession 5.3) 7 female paralegals trained to enhance referral pathway on SGBV and legal aid services 6.1) 2 internships at Bar Association (of which at least 2 women) 6.2) graduate law Curriculum introduced in Hargeisa University 6.3) 10 (5 women) scholarships awarded 6.4) 10 judicial trainers trained, disaggregated by sex. 6.5) 4 manuals for judges’ training developed 6.7) 3 trainings held for judges, prosecutors and lawyers 6.8) 50 judges, prosecutors and lawyers trained on the sentencing guidelines 7.1) 6 police stations in which a community policing initiative is implemented 7.2) 4 police stations constructed and equipped in targeted locations 7.3) 70 police officers and community members of regional community police stations educated and trained on community policing 7.4) 4 trainings delivered on rights-based community partnership policing, human rights, due process, child sensitive and gender responsive policing 7.5) 75 police officers trained in human rights, SGBV and child rights 7.5) a) Internal complaints system is implemented. b) Accompanying regulations drafted c) Regulations are approved by MOI 7.6) 50 Special Protection Unit personnel trained in their functions 8.1) Parole and probation policy approved by the Minister for Justice a) Parole regulation developed and approved by the Minister and parole manual developed. b) Parole Board/supervisory office set up c) Parole programme piloted in Hargeisa and women Prison Gabiley 8.2) 50 staff of the Parole Unit and custodial corps trained on new parole and probation disaggregated by sex 8.3) 100% parole board monitors trained on the new parole system 8.4) 50 human rights monitors trained on the new parole system. disaggregated by sex 8.5) 50 probation officers trained on new parole regulations and manual, disaggregated by sex 8.6) One PVE feasibility study delivered Capacity building of 50 of senior and junior managers on rehabilitative approaches. 8.7) 25 senior and 25 junior managers trained on rehabilitative approaches disaggregated by sex 9.1) 2 trainings for members and staff of the Human Rights and Security Committees of the parliament on issues of the security and human delivered to increase capacity in civilian oversight of the security institutions. 9.2) 15 members of the Armed Forces Courts trained in case management, fair trail, gender perspective 9.3) Armed Forces Courts Legislation review and reform plan developed 9.4) Human Security Threat Assessment and Security Policy developed and approved by the Minister. 9.5) Pension law passed by the parliament and signed by the president 10.1) a) 4 Rule of law and Human Rights sub working groups meetings held b) 4 Security sub working groups meetings held c) 4 Juvenile justice sub working groups meetings held 10.2) New Rule of Law and Security Sector Programme document developed & approved

As of June 2021: 1.1 2 workshops in 2020 and one in 2021 1.2 Zero 1.3 SL National disability Policy and the Disability Bill are currently under review to be completed in Q3 2021. TDR Policy is in progress Maritime legislation with EUCAP Somaliland is in progress Legal aid policy guidelines and bill is under progress.
2.1 Two coordinated consultation workshops are planned by MOJ in Burao and Borama in Q3 2021 3.1 45 Districts in Six regions of Somaliland. 3.2 Not yet established 3.3 All Six Regions (District, Regional and appeal Courts) 3.4 Judicial complaint mechanism is in place and being regularly monitored and reported upon 3.5 Construction planned to start in Q3 2021 3.6 Legal Aid Bill is ready for Parliamentary approval 3.7 National Legal Aid Policy and implementation guidelines are under review. 3.8 SLNHRC monitored 7 police stations and 2 prisons in Burco and Lasa Anood (Sool and Togdheer regions) examining the treatment and conditions of 545 imprisoned inmates and 112 detainees. (2021) The Inspection of 2 prisons by SLNHRC in Q2. MOJ drafted standard tools for SL prison inspection in consultation with UNSOM Corrections Advisor and monitoring and will be finalized in Q3.
4.1 Three SGBV Support ‘Baahikoob’ Centres supported and functional under the Hargeisa, Borama and Burco Hospitals 4.2 No trainings in 2021 4.3 45 will be trained in Q3 2021. 4.4 6 Women & Children Units established and functional under the six regional prosecution offices of Somaliland. 5.1 SWLA recruited 3 female paralegals in Baroma, 3 in Burao and 1 paralegal and 5 interns Hargeisa to support functioning of women’s associations
SWLA Offices in Gebiley, Hargiesa and Burco with functional legal aid lawyers and paralegals 4 (2 Lawyers and 2 paralegals) recruited and trained to provide legal representations and advice in Burco and Gebiley. SWLA supported 33 cases for Women in IDPs and Vulnerable in Burao (11) and Gebiley (22).
5.2 No progress 5.3 7 female paralegals trained and working (1:Waapo, 3:Burao and 3:Borama) 6.1 5 Interns (3 female and 2 male) interns working under SWLA (2021) 6.2 Planned for Q3 2021 6.3 20 LLM students (5: females, 15 male) from Justice Institutions, MOJ, Judiciary, Prosecutors, Solicitor Generals, are currently sponsored in Hargeisa University (2020/2021) 6.4 Not completed 6.5 Planned for Q3/4 6.7 Training will be done in Q3 after the recruitment of international Judiciary Training 6.8 Planned for Q3 2021 7.1 Two Police stations in regions of Burao and Borama will implement community policing initiatives in Q3 2021 7.2 The Construction of 8 Police stations is planned for Q3/Q4 2021 7.3 40 expected to be trained in Q3 2021 7.4 4 training models will be done in Q3/4 2021 7.5 40 to be trained in Q3 7.5 Zero 7.6 Implemented under elections programme 8.1 The framework of Partnership agreement with the Ministry of Justice has been discussed in Q1 2021. The process of engagement has initiated in March 2021 followed with the submission of requied documents in June 2021. 8.2 The activities are planned after the development of the parole regulation and manual 8.3 The activities are planned after the development of the prole regulation and manual and parole board supervisory office 8.4 The activities are planned after the development of the parole regulation and manual 8.5 The activities are planned after the development of the parole regulation and manual 2021 8.6 One feasibility study was completed and verified by the Ministry of Justice The launch of the report is planned in Q3
8.7 14 Junior managers were trained in Developing managers programme. Senior management training is scheduled for Q3 and Q4 in 2021
9.1 The sub-committees of the newly elected parliament to be trained by MOPCA in Q3 9.2 Preparatory work and strategic level discussions ongoing to identify the implementation approach and modalities 9.3 Preparatory work and strategic level discussions ongoing to identify the implementation approach and modalities 9.4 Preparatory work and strategic level discussions ongoing to identify the implementation approach and modalities 9.5 Preparatory work and strategic level discussions ongoing to identify the implementation approach and modalities 10.1 1 Human Rights and Rule of law Coordination meeting (36 participants) (17 June 2021) 10.2 Security Sub-sector 2nd Quarter Meeting scheduled for 14th July 2021 (organized by MOI)
